results.title: Countdown
results.brief_description: Countdown was a long-running popular weekly Australian music television show broadcast by the ABC from 8 November 1974 until 19 July 1987.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

results.description:
Countdown was a long-running popular weekly Australian music television show broadcast by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation from 8 November 1974 until 19 July 1987. It was created by Executive Producer Michael Shrimpton, producer/director Robbie Weekes and record producer and music journalist Ian “Molly” Meldrum. Countdown was produced at the studios of the ABC in the Melbourne suburb of Ripponlea.

Countdown was the most popular music program in Australian TV history. It was broadcast nationwide on Australia’s government-owned broadcaster, the ABC and commanded a huge and loyal audience. It soon exerted a strong influence on radio programmers because of its audience and the amount of Australian content it featured. For most of the time it was on air, it also gained double exposure throughout the country by screening a new episode each Sunday evening, and then repeating it the following Saturday evening. The majority of performances on the show were lip synched.

Molly Meldrum, the program’s talent co-ordinator, began appearing on-air in 1975, presenting the Humdrum music news segment and conducting interviews. Molly soon became the “face” of Countdown. He appeared regularly on-air until 1986. Another attraction to the program was the local & international acts who would host an episode - usually performing as well. During the show, Molly would interview them or have a chat with them before the show went out with the number 1 single of the week.
description_for_label:

results.title: Coraline: Creepy Coraline
results.creator_credit: Laura Gross and L.E.G. Productions Inc
results.brief_description: Stars: Dakota Fanning, Teri Hatcher, Henry Selick
results.description: Stars: Dakota Fanning, Teri Hatcher, Henry Selick

results.title: Cool Runnings
results.creator_credit: Grania Preston, Walt Disney Pictures, Dawn Steel, Jon Turteltaub, Lynn Siefert, Michael Ritchie, Tommy Swerdlow, Michael Goldberg and Stephen Marsh
results.brief_description: When a Jamaican sprinter is disqualified from the Olympic Games, he enlists the help of a dishonored coach to start the first Jamaican Bobsled Team.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Grania Preston, Walt Disney Pictures, Dawn Steel, Jon Turteltaub, Lynn Siefert, Michael Ritchie, Tommy Swerdlow, Michael Goldberg and Stephen Marsh
results.description: When a Jamaican sprinter is disqualified from the Olympic Games, he enlists the help of a dishonored coach to start the first Jamaican Bobsled Team.
description_for_label: When a Jamaican sprinter is disqualified from the Olympic Games, he enlists the help of a dishonored coach to start the first Jamaican Bobsled Team.

results.title: Conversations with a Killer: The Ted Bundy Tapes
results.brief_description: A unique look inside the mind of an infamous serial killer with this cinematic self-portrait crafted from statements made by Ted Bundy, including present-day interviews, archival footage and audio recordings from death row.

constellations_other.name: Dial M for Media
constellations_other.description: Explores the nature of media use in high-profile cases as well as the ability of media to sway public minds.

results.title_for_label: Conversations with a Killer: The Ted Bundy Tapes
results.description: A unique look inside the mind of an infamous serial killer with this cinematic self-portrait crafted from statements made by Ted Bundy, including present-day interviews, archival footage and audio recordings from death row.

results.title: Confessions of a Headhunter
results.creator_credit: Sally Riley, Archie Weller and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: In the film, two Noongar men – Frank and Vinnie – travel across the country and seek revenge for the repeated beheading of the statue of their ancestor warrior Yagan.

constellations_other.name: Laughing in the face of adversity
constellations_other.description: Comedy has been used by First Nations storytellers as a tool for social change. On our screens, humour invites audiences to engage with stories and prompts them to grapple with ideas that they otherwise might shy away from.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally Riley, Archie Weller and Scarlett Pictures
results.description: In the film, two Noongar men – Frank and Vinnie – travel across the country and seek revenge for the repeated beheading of the statue of their ancestor warrior Yagan.

results.title: Collective
results.creator_credit: Participant, Hanka Kastelicová, Alexander Nanau, Antoaneta Opris, Bianca Oana, Bernard Michaux, Magnolia Pictures, Sundance Institute, Luxembourg Film Fund, Centrul National al Cinematografiei (CNC), MDR, HBO Europe, Alexander Nanau Production and Samsa Film
results.brief_description: In the aftermath of a tragic fire in a Romanian club, burn victims begin dying in hospitals from wounds that were not life threatening. A team of investigative journalists move into action uncovering the mass corruption of the health system and of the state institutions. Collective follows journalists, whistle blowers, and authorities alike. An immersive and uncompromising look into a dysfunctional system, exposing corruption, propaganda, and manipulation that nowadays affect not only Romania, but societies around the world.

constellations_primary.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_primary.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Participant, Hanka Kastelicová, Alexander Nanau, Antoaneta Opris, Bianca Oana, Bernard Michaux, Magnolia Pictures, Sundance Institute, Luxembourg Film Fund, Centrul National al Cinematografiei (CNC), MDR, HBO Europe, Alexander Nanau Production and Samsa Film

Collective follows journalists, whistle blowers, and authorities alike. An immersive and uncompromising look into a dysfunctional system, exposing corruption, propaganda, and manipulation that nowadays affect not only Romania, but societies around the world.

results.title: Clueless
results.creator_credit: Adam Schroeder, Paramount, Robert Lawrence, Amy Heckerling, Steven J. Jordan, Mona May and Scott Rudin
results.brief_description: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school’s pecking scale. Seeing herself as a matchmaker, Cher first coaxes two teachers into dating each other. Emboldened by her success, she decides to give hopelessly klutzy new student Tai a makeover.

constellations_other.name: Horror movie right there on my TV
constellations_other.description: The colourful and quirky music video for Skyhooks’ song 'Horror Movie' helped propel them to number one, making it their biggest hit.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Adam Schroeder, Paramount, Robert Lawrence, Amy Heckerling, Steven J. Jordan, Mona May and Scott Rudin
results.description: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school’s pecking scale. Seeing herself as a matchmaker, Cher first coaxes two teachers into dating each other. Emboldened by her success, she decides to give hopelessly klutzy new student Tai a makeover. When Tai becomes more popular than she is, Cher realizes that her disapproving ex-stepbrother was right about how misguided she was — and falls for him.
description_for_label: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school’s pecking scale. When Tai becomes more popular than she is, Cher realizes that her disapproving ex-stepbrother was right about how misguided she was — and falls for him.

results.title: Cloverfield
results.creator_credit: Q Fortier, Martin Whist, Bryan Burk, Drew Goddard, Matt Reeves, David Baronoff, J.J. Abrams and Ellen Mirojnick
results.brief_description: Five young New Yorkers throw their friend a going-away party the night that a monster the size of a skyscraper descends upon the city. Told from the point of view of their video camera, the film is a document of their attempt to survive the most surreal, horrifying event of their lives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Q Fortier, Martin Whist, Bryan Burk, Drew Goddard, Matt Reeves, David Baronoff, J.J. Abrams and Ellen Mirojnick
results.description: Five young New Yorkers throw their friend a going-away party the night that a monster the size of a skyscraper descends upon the city. Told from the point of view of their video camera, the film is a document of their attempt to survive the most surreal, horrifying event of their lives.

results.title: Climate Change: The Facts
results.creator_credit: BBC Studios, IWC Media and Serena Davies
results.brief_description: After one of the hottest years on record, Sir David Attenborough looks at the science of climate change and potential solutions to this global threat. Interviews with some of the world’s leading climate scientists explore recent extreme weather conditions such as unprecedented storms and catastrophic wildfires. They also reveal what dangerous levels of climate change could mean for both human populations and the natural world in the future.

results.title: Cleverman
results.creator_credit: Jane Allen, Ryan Griffen, ABC-TV (Australia), Jacob Nash, Damir Peranovic, Pukeko Pictures and Goalpost Pictures
results.brief_description: Cleverman stormed onto ABC TV in 2016 as a dystopian sci-fi with a difference. With predominantly Indigenous cast and senior crew, the series explores a series of Aboriginal origin stories in a contemporary context, with political nuance touching on themes of class, racism and power.

constellations_other.name: Alternate histories and futures
constellations_other.description: Sue Ford's Egami reimagines contemporary life through a feminist and colonial lens.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Jedda: Uneven ground, the road to on-screen diversity
constellations_other.description: Jedda was the first fully funded Australian feature to be shot on colour film. It was also the first Australian film with Aboriginal actors in lead roles, however, it reflects a deeply problematic time in Australian history.

constellations_other.name: Canopy
constellations_other.description: John Harvey is a Torres Strait Islander producer, director and writer in screen and stage whose work Canopy celebrates Indigenous self-representation.

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Allen, Ryan Griffen, ABC-TV (Australia), Jacob Nash, Damir Peranovic, Pukeko Pictures and Goalpost Pictures
results.description:
Cleverman stormed onto ABC TV in 2016 as a dystopian sci-fi with a difference. With predominantly Indigenous cast and senior crew, the series explores a series of Aboriginal origin stories in a contemporary context, with political nuance touching on themes of class, racism and power.

Exploring First Peoples storytelling, language and creativity in production design, costumes and props, this free exhibition invites you to listen-first and immerse yourself in a powerful and contemporary expression of origin stories.

In late December 2018 until April 2019, we staged an exhibition on Cleverman that explored the making of the TV series, and including props, costumes and make-up, designs by Weta Workshop and artwork from the original comic book series.

The exhibition was co-curated by Cleverman concept creator Ryan Griffen and production designer Jacob Nash. Exhibition research partners Prof. Angela Ndalianis and Dr Liam Burke, Swinburne University of Technology.
description_for_label:
